intro: Brunellia inermis, commonly known as the Brazilian ironwood, is a tropical tree native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, hard wood and evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows in humid lowland forests and can reach heights of up to 30 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy appearance. The flowers are small, clustered, and usually white or yellow, followed by small, spherical fruits.
